alert.note: Alert for Anderson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 03 at 9:16PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1100 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN CLAIBORNE...NORTHERN ANDERSON...CAMPBELL...SCOTT AND UNION COUNTIES... At 1015 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles northwest of Maynardville to 12 miles southwest of Jacksboro, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... La Follette, Oneida, Maynardville, Jacksboro, Huntsville, Helenwood, Jellico, Caryville, Rocky Top and Norris. This includes Interstate 75 in Tennessee between mile markers 124 and 161. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
